describe: Timor-Leste, also known as East Timor, is a Southeast Asian nation occupying half the island of Timor. It is known for its rich cultural heritage, beautiful landscapes, and a history of resilience. The country gained independence in 2002 and has since been developing its economy and infrastructure. Timor-Leste is characterized by its mountainous terrain, tropical climate, and diverse ecosystems.

cities.name: üèù Dili
cities.geographical_location: Located on the northern coast of Timor island, Dili is the capital and largest city of Timor-Leste.
cities.climate: Dili has a tropical savanna climate with a distinct wet and dry season.
cities.famous_cuisine: Ikan Pepes, Batar Da'an, and Tapai

cities.name: üèù Baucau
cities.geographical_location: Situated on the northern coast, east of Dili, Baucau is the second-largest city in Timor-Leste.
cities.climate: Baucau experiences a tropical climate with a wet and dry season, similar to Dili.
